name: ChatGPT Free
summary_and_recommendation: BLOCK for enterprise use. ChatGPT Free has critical enterprise governance gaps including no admin controls, guaranteed training data usage, and consumer-grade privacy protections. Suitable only for non-confidential public content generation with explicit user training opt-out.
data_classification: Should only be used with Public/Marketing Data
assessment_notes: High confidence based on comprehensive public documentation. Limited enterprise-specific documentation for free tier.

required_permissions: No specific Azure permissions - web-based service
recommended_restrictions: Implement URL filtering for ChatGPT domains

recommendations.title: Block ChatGPT Free for Enterprise Use
recommendations.description: The free version lacks enterprise controls and uses data for training. Block access and direct users to approved alternatives.

recommendations.title: Implement Network-Level Blocking
recommendations.description: Use firewall rules to block access to chat.openai.com and related domains for enterprise networks.

recommendations.title: User Education Program
recommendations.description: Educate users about the risks of using free AI tools with corporate data and provide approved alternatives.

detailed_assessment.summary_and_recommendation: BLOCK for enterprise use. ChatGPT Free has critical enterprise governance gaps including no admin controls, guaranteed training data usage, and consumer-grade privacy protections. Suitable only for non-confidential public content generation with explicit user training opt-out.

geographic_control.justification: 'External servers, unclear location' - OpenAI operates globally with servers in multiple jurisdictions. While they mention enterprise data residency controls, free tier users have no geographic control options documented.

encryption_standards.justification: 'Enterprise-Grade Encryption' - OpenAI documentation confirms 'Data encryption at rest (AES-256) and in transit between our customers and us, and between us and our service providers (TLS 1.2+)'. Published encryption specifications available.

data_retention.justification: ' Indefinite/Unclear Retention' + 3 additional points - While OpenAI states 30-day retention for disabled history, default retention for chat history is indefinite with no automatic deletion. Users must manually delete conversations. Recent legal developments suggest indefinite retention may be required due to litigation.

model_training.justification: 'Default training use with difficult opt-out' - ChatGPT Free uses conversations for model training by default. While OpenAI now provides an opt-out option, it requires navigating settings and is not prominently presented to users.

data_sharing.justification: 'Broad sharing or unclear sharing practices' - OpenAI's privacy policy mentions sharing with service providers and for legal compliance, but lacks specific details about third-party relationships for the free tier.

admin_management.justification: 'No Admin Oversight' - ChatGPT Free provides individual accounts only with no organizational visibility or centralized management capabilities. No admin dashboard or user provisioning available.

audit_capabilities.justification: 'No Audit Capabilities' - Free version provides no activity logs accessible to administrators, no usage tracking for organizations, and no audit trail capabilities.

integration.justification: 'No Enterprise Integration' - ChatGPT Free requires username/password authentication only, with no SSO support, no enterprise identity management, and no API access for enterprise management.

regulatory_violations.justification: 'Fully Compliant' - OpenAI maintains SOC 2 Type 2 compliance, has documented GDPR compliance measures, and provides Business Associate Agreements. Recent SOC 2 Type 2 report covers ChatGPT products through June 2024.

data_processing_transparency.justification: 'Basic Transparency' - OpenAI provides general data processing descriptions and retention periods, with some third-party relationships disclosed, but lacks detailed data flow diagrams for the free tier.

documentation_and_support.justification: 'No Transparency' - While OpenAI provides extensive documentation for enterprise products, the free tier has limited security documentation, no dedicated support (community support only), and lacks enterprise-specific transparency reports.

use_case_multiplier_applied.data_classification: Should only be used with Public/Marketing Data
